intro: Corydalis lineariloba var. lineariloba, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia, particularly China and Nepal. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces showy, spurred flowers in shades of pink or purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
